dlgLine.text: This morning, we found evidence of a break-in in the school's storage closet. By my count, twenty antibiotics are missing.
We don't have much to go on right now.
I've taken statements from the people who were unaccounted for during the time the theft took place. I'll read them back for you.
I was on the roof, smoking. If I really needed them that badly, I would have asked.
So anytime anyone steals anything here, it's automatically me? Uh-huh... You know if I did it - and I didn't - but if I did, you wouldn't even know they were missing.
Me? Have I ever given you the impression that I would do something like that? I can't believe you even asked me.
Man... Someone stole some stuff? That's messed up. I mean, I could try and help find some more.
Why is everyone always blaming me for stuff! Everyone knows thieves aren't smart - that's why they had to turn to crime.
So... We have accounts from witnesses and we have statements from the suspects. From the evidence and testimonies - who should we call in for sentencing?
Aggro Moss - you have been accused of the crime of theft. Do you have anything to say for yourself?
I didn't do it. This is bullshit.
Effrem Montague - you have been accused of theft-
Man, this is bullshit! I didn't do it! This trial is fixed - I'm not taking the blame for this!
Oscar Guzman - you have been accused of the crime of theft. Do you have anything to say for yourself?
<To you> <charname>, I can't believe you of all people would think I did this. You know I wouldn't...
Troy Cooper - you have been accused of the crime of theft. Do you have anything to say for yourself?
Doug Schultz - you have been accused of the crime of theft. Do you have anything to say for yourself?
WHAT? I can't believe I'm hearing this! Me? A thief?! This is a travesty of justice! Where's the evidence? I want an investigation!
Before we go on, we need to figure out a punishment for-
Wait! They didn't do it! This ain't about them - it's me you want.
I have something to confess. I took those antibiotics... See, I got a bad cut while I was out the other day, and I didn't tell anyone since I didn't want to look weak.

But that cut was looking worse, so I knew I needed them antibiotics. But I didn't want to tell no one and let them think I was too weak to do my job. I didn't know if they would let me have them and I damn well didn't want to lose my leg.

So I took 'em. But all this time - while you been looking for a thief, the guilt was eating me up inside. I kept thinkin' how sad my momma would be at me. Anyhow - I took a few already, but here's the rest back.
Thank you for your honesty, Troy.
I'll leave it up to you to decide on a punishment - if any - that you think would be suitable here.
Honest or not - he still stole from us. And I think the best punishment we can give in a situation like this is to ration his food while he goes out and looks for more antibiotics.
<To you> I'll back whatever you think's appropriate.
Ration him for a week as parole. But Troy - you pull something like this and I'll lock you up.
He came clean and there wasn't any major harm. Let's not turn this into a spectacle.
<To you> I'm hoping you'll go easy on him, but you do what you have to - I'll support you.
Forget it - he's just an idiot. We can't punish him for that.

I have very little tolerance for thieves - it creates suspicion and breaks down the trust needed to make a team effective. We need real punishment for this - cut off his food for a few days. If he steals again, beat him.
<To you> If you have other plans, I can maybe change my opinion.
Food is life right now. If they all know the penalty is starvation, they'll think twice about stealing.

Stealing from others - that's fun. Stealing from your own - that's a crime. Now, I want to say Troy should receive a beatdown, but Bubbas tend to be thick-skulled, so best way to punish him is to starve him.
<To you> You got other ideas, I'm willing to hear them.
If Troy's so good at surviving, he can find his own damn food a few days.
I think Troy has done the brave thing and admitted his mistake. We should forgive him for the crime.
<To you> If you feel the need to punish him, I understand.
He was honest - we should give him a second chance.
We can't overlook a crime, even if he was honest. He should suffer some form of punishment - let's say a whole week of reduced rations. It sends a message to others too.
<To you> You know what I'd vote for. However, you have my support for whatever you decide.
Of course, he should still work, even if we reduce his rations. And maybe get him to cut that ridiculous hair of his while we're at it.
<To you> It's time to make a decision. How should we punish Troy?

dlgAnsw.text: We will forgive Troy for his crime. It was petty theft and he was honest with us.
Troy - for your crime, you will be exiled from the shelter immediately. We will not tolerate theft.
Stealing is a serious crime. No rations for five days.
He should be punished - one week of reduced rations.
We ate yesterday, so today we go without. We will resume normal rations tomorrow.
We have too many mouths to feed. Leave it to me... I'll take care of our problem the more direct way.

dlgLine.text: Because he confessed, Troy will be forgiven for his crime.

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to exile Troy for his crime. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: Yes, that's my final decision. Remove him immediately.
On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: As a punishment for his crime, Troy will receive no rations for five days. He's responsible for procuring his own food.

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: Troy will recieve one week of reduced rations for his crime.

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to cut food to the whole shelter for today in order to preserve more food for the future. It will be crucial that we find more food today. Is this your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: ...I'm not sure I agree with the implication of that decision. Are you sure that's how you want to proceed?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The sentence is decided - Troy will be forgiven for his crimes.
I think this sends the wrong message, but maybe people will appreciate your compassion.
I think we're sending the wrong message, and I expect it's only a matter of time before something else goes missing.
Best not to turn this into an ordeal. We've got more important matters to attend to.
Best not to turn this into an ordeal. We've got more important matters to attend to.
If that's your decision, guess we'll go with that.
You just told the whole place it's okay to steal as long as give a convincing sob story.
I'll back you on this... but I think he's getting off easy.
If I were running things, the only thing filling him up'd be my foot up his ass.
I think this says a lot about your compassion and goes a long way to turning this into a viable society again.
I think this says a lot about your compassion and goes a long way to turning this into a viable society again.
Well... they can't all be great decisions.
I think this is sending the wrong message about how we deal with crime here. This is the kind of slap on the wrist that turned the justice system into a revolving door.
Troy will be exiled from the school immediately.
I'm not sure this is the best way to go about this, but I'll back you this time.
Really?! For stealing a minor amount of antibiotics? Where the hell are we - America or North Korea?
You obviously feel strongly about this...
The poor kid's barely able to look us in the eyes! You're going to send him out, most likely to his death? Ridiculous.
I think there are better ways to handle this, but if that's how it's going down, I'll go along with it.
You know, there's a difference between strict and batshit insane, right?
I won't miss him. That's something, I guess.
The women use more toilet paper than the men - we should probably be flogged right? I figured that was the case, since you're running a death camp now.
I'm not really sure what to think about this...
Troy was a friend. Yes, he maded a mistake, but this is an extreme punishment for such a minor crime.
<Sigh>I don't like this, but I'll support it...
This is outrageous! If this is policy for now on, maybe we should just see if Stalin has come back to life.
Troy will receive suspended rations for five days.
Kind of harsh... But maybe it'll make a point.
Isn't this overdoing it? Even prisoners in the hole get fed.
...I really was hoping you would go another way, but I'll support you this time.
Starvation is a form of torture.
I doubt anyone will try to steal from us now.
I doubt anyone will try to steal from us now.
It's tough, but it sends a message. I bet it'll only take three days before he tries to eat a book - anyone want to go in on that?
It's tough, but it sends a message. I bet it'll only take three days before he tries to eat a book - anyone want to go in on that?
That's not exactly a fitting punishment, but if you think it's for the best...
I'm not sure this is the right way to go about this, especially considering he confessed.
Okay... If you think that's the way to do it.
Look, I'm usually fine with being tough on crime, but this is a bit extremist.
Troy will be given reduced rations for a week.
It's tough, but it's fair. It shows that there is a consequence for your actions.
It's tough, but it's fair. It shows that there is a consequence for your actions.
It's not necessary, but I can support this.
You're making a big deal about this. If anything, it sends the message that honesty will be punished.
It'll do.
It sends the message that you're soft on crime. Oh, you'll be punished, but delicately.
Fine. It's kind of a compromise, I guess.
You're just encouraging others. You needed to make a proper example out of him.
It's not as bad as it could be...
He did the right thing. I wish you would reconsider.
That's good policy - it shows we're willing to punish people fairly, but without compromising our authority.
That's good policy - it shows we're willing to punish people fairly, but without compromising our authority.
The decision is to cut all food today, conserve resources for the future, and hopefully secure more food immediately.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
I'm really not happy about this, but I'll back you up because I have confidence you won't make this a weekly event.
No food today? And what happens if we're attacked or driven out of here? We'll be dead on our feet. <Shakes his head> You people...
Do I look like I diet? Still, I guess you've stuck your neck out for me before, so I can deal with it.
So let me get this straight - I don't eat and you'll probably make me do the heavy lifting out there? Well, why didn't you say we were having shit sandwiches for dinner?
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
The decision is to... find a way to reduce the population here at the shelter through whatever means necessary.
I... I really hope that you mean you're going to find a volunteer.
What the hell is this - the damn mafia? I swear on my goddamn life that if I hear you took someone behind a shed and put a bullet in them about this, I'm taking you down!
I have to believe you've got a better plan than just fragging the last person to piss you off. Right?
If you're going to turn this into a dictatorship, you better believe I will work with everyone else to depose you.
Well, does anyone want to pick the last guy left for the dodgeball team, really? It's harsh but they're probably not going to last long anyhow.
Well, does anyone want to pick the last guy left for the dodgeball team, really? It's harsh but they're probably not going to last long anyhow.
If you're going to rule by fear, I say you have to draw a line somewhere, but on the other hand I'm fairly sure you won't pick me, so I'm willing to let it slide.
That sounds like something Marshall would do... And I'm sure as hell not going to stay if I have to live in fear of being on your shit list.
I hope this is just a misunderstanding... Based on our previous actions, I have to believe you're going to do the right thing.
I know that sometimes you have to kill because otherwise we all would be killed. But murder is a sin...
Well... I suppose you could always find someone who's unhappy and give them the option to leave...
No one is judge, jury, and executioner - this is madness! If this is how you intend to run the place, maybe it's time to elect a new leader!
Thank you all for your input. This meeting is over.
